actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to extend the right to vote to citizens who are sixteen years of age or older, and to repeal the twenty-sixth article of amendment to the Constitution.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Grants a citizen of the United States who is 16 years of age or older the right to vote. Repeals the 16th Amendment to the Constitution requiring a citizen to be at least 18 years of age to vote.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to extend the right to vote to citizens who are sixteen years of age or older, and to repeal the twenty-sixth article of amendment to the Constitution.
